did.abstract: A small collection of legal and financial papers—bonds, deeds, receipts, etc.—relating to Peter McCartee (circa 1764-1834) of Manhattan.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Joyce Healy, 2016 (accession no. MS-2016-24).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by topic or document type, then chronologically.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter McCartee, (circa 1764-1834), was a currier, or leather processor, who did business at 12 Jacob Street, in a locality of lower Manhattan known as "The Swamp" for its concentration of tanneries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as "Peter McCartee Legal Papers, MS 3245, New-York Historical Society."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Archivist Joseph Ditta arranged and described this collection in January-February 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Winterthur Library has a similar, small collection of such material in their Tooker Family Papers, which include a number of items pertaining to Peter McCartee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bonds, correspondence, deeds, guardianships, powers of attorney, and receipts pertaining to Peter McCartee (circa 1764-1834), a currier (leather processor) of Manhattan. It is unclear exactly how some of the disparate materials here concern McCartee or his estate—he died in 1834, and the collection extends to 1876—but they were donated as pertaining to him.
